quiz.title: Pre-calculus: Unit 8 Quiz 9
quiz.subtitle: 8.9: Inverse Sine and Cosine
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Evaluating arcsin and arccos within restricted ranges

questions.question: What is the restricted range for $y = \arcsin x$?
questions.explanation: To make sine one-to-one, we limit the output to the right half of the unit circle (Quadrants I and IV).

questions.question: What is the restricted range for $y = \arccos x$?
questions.explanation: To make cosine one-to-one, we limit the output to the top half of the unit circle (Quadrants I and II).

questions.question: Evaluate $\arcsin(1/2)$ in radians.
questions.explanation: We look for the angle in the range $[-\pi/2, \pi/2]$ where $\sin \theta = 1/2$, which is $30^\circ$ or $\pi/6$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\arccos(0)$.
questions.explanation: The angle in $[0, \pi]$ where $\cos \theta = 0$ is $90^\circ$ or $\pi/2$.

questions.question: Why can't we evaluate $\arcsin(2)$?
options: The input is outside the domain of [-1, 1].
The output must be in radians.
questions.explanation: Since the maximum value of sine is 1, there is no real angle that produces a sine of 2.

questions.question: Evaluate $\arccos(-1)$.
questions.explanation: On the unit circle, the x-coordinate is $-1$ at $180^\circ$, which is $\pi$.

questions.question: What is the value of $\sin(\arcsin(0.5))$?
questions.explanation: A function and its inverse 'undo' each other, provided the value is within the domain.

questions.question: Evaluate $\arcsin(-1)$.
questions.explanation: While $3\pi/2$ has a sine of $-1$, it is outside the range $[-\pi/2, \pi/2]$. We must use the coterminal value $-\pi/2$.

questions.question: In which quadrant is the output of $\arccos x$ if $x$ is negative?
questions.explanation: Since the range is $[0, \pi]$, and cosine is negative in Q2, the result must be in Q2.

questions.question: True or False: $\arcsin(x) = 1 / \sin(x)$.
questions.explanation: False. $\arcsin x$ is the inverse function (finding the angle), while $1/\sin x$ is the reciprocal function (Cosecant).

scoreMessages.90: Inverse expert! You navigated the ranges perfectly.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Remember: Arccos is Q1 & Q2; Arcsin is Q1 & Q4!
scoreMessages.50: Be careful with negative inputs; they push the angle into Q2 for Arccos or Q4 for Arcsin.
scoreMessages.0: Review the restricted ranges for inverse sine and cosine.
